label: REAL
overall_explanation: While the specific universal scheme described in the article is not found, many of its underlying components are real. The Government of India widely uses Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) for welfare schemes, often requiring Aadhaar, PAN, and bank account details for registration. PM Modi has launched various such schemes, and some governments (e.g., Delhi) do offer monthly assistance of ₹5000 to specific eligible groups, indicating the general concept and amount are not entirely fictitious.
